decision_conditions:
<p>No permission is granted for the removal of any original plasterwork. All new decorative plasterwork
(including cornices and ceiling roses) shall accurately replicate, in terms of material. profile and
detailing of the historic plasterwork surviving to the property or where this does not survive to a
comparable house forming part of the De Beauvoir Square. </p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that the proposal respects the historic fabric of the listed building.<br></p>

<p>All new works, and works of making good to the retained fabric, whether internal or external, shall be
finished to match the original work with regard to the methods used and to material, dimensions,
composition, form, colour, finish and profile, and in the case of brickwork, facebond and pointing.
</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure the proposal respects the historic fabric of the listed building.<br></p>

The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.

The Development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this consent.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of Section 18(a) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 as amended.
